str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To meditate upon, reflect upon, ponder. From a compound of en and thumos; to be inspirited, i.e. Ponder.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A spectacle, vision, that which is seen. From horao; something gazed at, i.e. A spectacle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Three. Or neuter tria a primary number; 'three'.
A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To seek, search for, desire, require, demand. Of uncertain affinity; to seek; specially, to worship, or to plot.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
